column5: Work has kept me extremely busy since the ice went out and with the exception of the May long week end I haven't been fishing at all. But the rewards of long hours and endless day at wok payed off. My daughter and I left 4.30 Saturday morn for our camping/my fishing spot to join our life long friends and family. As soon as I got there at 8.30am I set up the boat and was told to go fishing and they would look after Erin and so on the water I went. Started looking for the big pike but no luck. So I tried a few of my go to lures and still nothing so I decided to try a lure I bought on the way up on a whim and wouldn't you know SUCCESS. I couldn't get the big ones out to play but the kids had fun. Saturdays morning catch.[url=http://s1198.photobucket.com/user/saltydawg43/media/phonepics212.jpg.html]   .  And finaly smores.   Looking forward to the August long week end when we all meet up again. And another chance to go after the big one lurking.  Don.
hmm, I see nothing but spiders...
Yep not shure whats going on with that???
Great photos.  I don't know what woodenboater is talkin' about.
Well it is kind of a cool spider its sitting on a 2x4  I will try again later once I get this pic problem sorted out.
All I see is the same pic of the spider

Well for some reason I cant get the image of the spider to go away no matter what IMG code I select from photobucket??? Sorry for waisting your time. I did have some nice fish on there but I fear it may be lost now.  Don. Till next time.
did you get a chance to try "them"?
Is that spider actually kinda big or is this the 'hold the fish out so it looks huge' trick
I hope you don't mind, but I named the spider "Ziggy". Must be from Mars. HH
